+package org.tensorflow.op;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.List;
+
+import org.tensorflow.Input;
+import org.tensorflow.OperationBuilder;
+import org.tensorflow.Output;
+
+/** Utilities for manipulating input related types and lists. */
body:
Ok, got it ;) Well, my opinion on this is pretty much the same as yours: all this `Output/Input` conversion is confusing as both terms sound contradictory but are used to represent the exact same thing in two different contexts, plus one being a concrete class and the other an interface.

`Operand` is more "neutral" so might effectively results in less brain glitches, I like it. But I think it would be nice to discuss more about it, can we address this as a separate issue?
body_html:

Operand is more "neutral" so might effectively results in less brain glitches, I like it. But I think it would be nice to discuss more about it, can we address this as a separate issue?
body_text:
Ok, got it ;) Well, my opinion on this is pretty much the same as yours: all this Output/Input conversion is confusing as both terms sound contradictory but are used to represent the exact same thing in two different contexts, plus one being a concrete class and the other an interface.
Operand is more "neutral" so might effectively results in less brain glitches, I like it. But I think it would be nice to discuss more about it, can we address this as a separate issue?
